page.title: 05WOODSTOCK'S PUBS AND HOTELS
page.content: Woodstock has many pubs and hotels. The Bear is an oustanding traditional hotel located in an old coaching inn and furnished with antiques. In room 14, a ghost was last seen in 1823. The Feathers Hotel was converted from four houses one of which is haunted. The hotel got its name from all the stuffed birds found there. It recently won an award from the A.A. The Woodstock Arms has been run by the new owner for five years and benefits from the tourist trade. It is 500 years old and has a friendly atmosphere and a good range of bar meals. Brothertons is a new restaurant named a shop owned by the same family for 105 years. Woodstock is a popular venue for afternoon teas and meals, with students tourists and residents of the locality.
